pageContext.claim: “I mean these generals. There's no person in Hollywood that could play the role. These guys are like perfect people. I said, ‘What's your name?’ ‘Sir, my name is Raisin.’ What the hell kind of a name? I said, ‘Raisin, like the fruit?’ He goes, ‘Yes, sir, Raisin.’ ‘What’s your last name?’ ‘Caine. Raisin Caine.’ I just made him a big star. Just like I did with [James] Mattis when I said, ‘We’re gonna give you a new nickname cause “Chaos” is not a good nickname.’ So we changed his name, called him Mad Dog.”
pageContext.analysis: Brig. Gen. Daniel J. Caine does indeed go by the nickname "Raisin." But Trump did not coin Mattis's nickname, "Mad Dog." Mattis said at his confirmation hearing in the Senate that the press gave him that nickname, which he considered inaccurate, for some of his remarks.
